IT Support Officer Job at Vitafoam Nigeria Plc




        
    

        
        Vitafoam Nigeria Plc is Nigeria's leading manufacturer of flexible, reconstituted and rigid foam products. It has the largest foam manufacturing and distribution network, which facilitates just-in-time delivery of its products throughout Nigeria. Incorporated on 4th August, 1962 and listed on the floor of the Nigerian Stock Exchange in 1978. Vitafoam's successful brands remain household names in the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Resolve hardware, software, network, and system issues efficiently via phone, email, or in-person.
	Perform routine maintenance, patching, upgrades, and troubleshooting on all company workstations, laptops, and servers.
	Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights across various systems (e.g., Active Directory, cloud platforms).
	Set up and configure new employee equipment and accounts, and securely decommission equipment for departing staff.
	Maintain clear, up-to-date documentation of IT procedures, inventory, and support resolutions.
	Track and manage IT assets, ensuring accurate inventory records.
	Assist in implementing and enforcing IT security policies, including managing anti-virus and monitoring for threats.


Requirements


	Education: A degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
	Experience: Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in an IT Support or Help Desk role.
	Technical Proficiency.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: onyeneho.nneoma@gmail.com using "IT Support Officer" as the subject of the mail.

Personal Assistant & Social Media Manager Job at Elvaridah




        
    

        
        Elvaridah is a Business Development Company with the primary objective of working with businesses and business owners to start up their businesses, improve, differentiate or expand already existing ones.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant & Social Media Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Working Hours: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Monday – Saturday (one day off)

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly organized, creative, and child-friendly Personal Assistant & Social Media Manager to support the CEO with day-to-day administrative tasks while managing the brand’s online presence.
	This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about children’s activities, possesses strong digital content creation skills, and enjoys bringing creative ideas to life.
	You will work closely with the CEO to manage schedules, coordinate personal and business tasks, and manage the social media page. The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and able to multitask in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities
Administrative & Personal Support:


	Manage the CEO’s daily schedule, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Handle personal tasks, errands, and confidential administrative responsibilities.
	Coordinate communication on behalf of the CEO, including emails and follow-ups.
	Assist with planning and organizing meetings, activities, and project timelines.


Social Media & Content Creation:


	Create engaging visual and written content for social media platforms.
	Manage online pages, ensuring consistent brand voice and timely posting.
	Track engagement, trends, and insights to optimize content performance.
	Support the design of graphics, presentations, and digital materials using Canva or similar tools.


Children-Focused Activities & Creative Support:


	Assist in planning and coordinating children’s events, activities, and programs (ages 4–12).
	Provide creative input for child-friendly content, visuals, and storytelling.
	Help source educational, recreational, and developmental materials for children-related projects.
	Support event logistics, branding, and execution.


General Support:


	Organize and maintain digital files and creative assets.
	Conduct research to support creative, administrative, and brand-related initiatives.
	Help ensure consistency in brand presentation across all materials and platforms.
	Collaborate with the CEO and team on special projects as assigned.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Social Sciences, Education, or a related field (or relevant experience).
	Proven experience in social media management, content creation, or personal assistance.
	Proficiency in Canva or Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) is an advantage.
	Strong creativity, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	A natural interest in children and child-focused activities.
	Professionalism, confidentiality, and a high level of discretion.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.
	Basic understanding of digital marketing and social media trends.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

School Administrator Job at You Centred Consulting




        
    

        
        You Centred Consulting is a forward-thinking technology company based in Lagos, Nigeria, committed to fostering a smarter and more connected economy. We specialize in software development for the Insurance, Financial, and Health Management Organization (HMO) sectors within Nigeria, with an ambitious vision to expand our services across Africa. Our experienced team is dedicated to customer success, delivering top-tier project services through innovative, precise, and effective solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: School Administrator

Job Location: Ikotun Egbe, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time / Permanent

Role Brief
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are searching for a trustworthy and personable School Administrator to join our learning institution.
	The school administrator’s responsibilities include handling all allocated tasks, answering questions and queries, understanding the school’s policies, assisting with the recruitment of new staff members, and communicating with parents, teachers, and students as required.
	You should be able to take charge of your department and provide the necessary supervision.
	To be successful as a school administrator, you should be detail-oriented without losing sight of the bigger picture.
	Outstanding candidates have the capacity to handle multiple responsibilities and don't lose their nerve under pressure.


Responsibilities


	Understanding and reviewing the way the school and all its department’s function.
	Taking into account each teacher’s workload and extracurricular activities when developing class schedules.
	Conducting research on professional and ongoing learning workshops and sharing these opportunities with teachers and other staff.
	Attending meetings and scheduling appropriate staff team building sessions.
	Ensuring fair allocation of budget and resources.
	Keeping track of student successes and failures and preparing appropriate interventions.
	Managing school security, caretakers, and other ground staff.
	Assisting with the hiring, recruitment, training, and onboarding of new teachers.
	Establishing and maintaining good relationships with parents, students, and staff at other schools.
	Preparing and submitting drafts of proposals, financial reports, and other documents.


Requirements


	First degree – HND / BA / BEd. / Bsc / BTech. Etc
	Relevant license and certification may be required.
	Extensive teaching or school administration experience may be required.
	Knowledge of and practical experience with the relevant software.
	Excellent leadership, organizational, management, and communication skills.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as the ability to remain professional.
	A willingness to work overtime.


Method of Application
